alert.note: Alert for Alamance (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 7:25PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Alamance, Chatham, Cumberland, Durham, Harnett, Hoke, Lee, Moore, Orange, Richmond, Scotland and Wake. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas and ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 724 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This may cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Fayetteville, Cary, Chapel Hill, Burlington, Sanford, Laurinburg, Graham, Southern Pines, Hillsborough, Raeford, Pittsboro, Lillington, Carthage, Fort Bragg, Siler City, Garner and Carrboro.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Slow down and use caution while driving to avoid hydroplaning. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
